intro: Hieracium pinetophilum, commonly known as the pine forest hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the pine forests of eastern North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense, flat-topped clusters, which bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture, often with a reddish or purple tint on the underside. Hieracium pinetophilum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open areas within pine woodlands.
